skill.name: ui-ux-pro-max
skill.description: UI/UX design intelligence. 50 styles, 21 palettes, 50 font pairings, 20 charts, 8 stacks (React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, Tailwind). Actions: plan, build, create, design, implement, review, fix, improve, optimize, enhance, refactor, check UI/UX code. Projects: website, landing page, dashboard, admin panel, e-commerce, SaaS, portfolio, blog, mobile app, .html, .tsx, .vue, .svelte. Elements: button, modal, navbar, sidebar, card, table, form, chart. Styles: glassmorphism, claymorphism, minimalism, brutalism, neumorphism, bento grid, dark mode, responsive, skeuomorphism, flat design. Topics: color palette, accessibility, animation, layout, typography, font pairing, spacing, hover, shadow, gradient.
skill.summary: UI/UX design intelligence. 50 styles, 21 palettes, 50 font pairings, 20 charts, 8 stacks (React, Nex...
skill.author: nextlevelbuilder

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only Python search scripts and CSV data files. It performs read-only BM25 text search on local data files within the skill directory. No network operations, file writes, command execution, or environment variable access. Purely a design database lookup tool.

content.user_title: Find UI styles, color palettes, and design guidelines
content.value_statement: AI assistants lack design knowledge. This skill provides searchable databases of 50 UI styles, 21 color palettes, 50 font pairings, chart recommendations, and UX best practices for any project type. It helps generate professional designs faster.
actual_capabilities: Search 50 UI styles including glassmorphism, brutalism, neumorphism, and minimalism
Find color palettes for 45+ product types from SaaS to luxury brands
Get 50 font pairings with Google Fonts imports and Tailwind config
Access chart recommendations for data visualization by data type
Retrieve stack-specific guidelines for React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, Flutter, and Tailwind
Look up UX best practices and anti-patterns for accessibility, animation, and layout
limitations: Does not generate code - only provides design guidance and recommendations
Does not access external APIs or live design resources
Does not validate or test generated code
Requires Python 3 to run the search scripts

use_cases.title: Build dashboards faster
use_cases.description: Get color palettes, chart types, and Tailwind guidelines for data-heavy applications.

use_cases.title: Design better UIs
use_cases.description: Access style recommendations, font pairings, and UX best practices when building websites.

use_cases.title: Research design patterns
use_cases.description: Explore 50+ UI styles and 45+ product-specific recommendations for inspiration.

prompt_templates.title: Quick style lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Search style with keywords: glassmorphism elegant modern

prompt_templates.title: Color palette
prompt_templates.prompt: Search color for saas fintech startup

prompt_templates.title: Typography
prompt_templates.prompt: Search typography for elegant luxury brand

prompt_templates.title: Full design guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Search product for beauty spa wellness then search color, typography, style, ux, and landing

output: Primary: Calm blue + health green + trust
Key considerations: Accessibility mandatory, calming aesthetic
Best fonts: Clean sans-serif with high readability
Chart types: Progress indicators, health metrics displays

best_practices: Use the product domain first to get style recommendations tailored to your project type.
Combine multiple searches for complete design guidance (style + typography + color).
Always search UX guidelines for accessibility and animation best practices.
anti_patterns: Do not use emojis as icons - use SVG icons from Heroicons or Lucide instead.
Avoid using scale transforms on hover that cause layout shifts.
Do not skip accessibility checks when building production UIs.

faq.question: What stacks are supported?
faq.answer: HTML Tailwind, React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, Nuxt.js, and Nuxt UI.

faq.question: How many results are returned?
faq.answer: Default is 3 results. Use --max-results or -n flag to change.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Works with Claude, Codex, Claude Code, Windsurf, Cursor, and any agent with Python access.

faq.question: Is user data stored or sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads local CSV files. No network calls or data collection.

faq.question: Why is my search not returning results?
faq.answer: Try different keywords or shorter terms. The BM25 search requires at least some matching terms.

faq.question: How is this different from other design tools?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill for AI assistants. It provides actionable guidance rather than generating designs directly.
